block.p: Results of tests on the former Montreal Canadiens great Maurice Richard for a suspected recurrence of abdominal cancer are expected next week, his agent said yesterday.
The agent, Jean Roy, said Richard, 78, known as the Rocket, may be released from Hotel Dieu hospital in Montreal today.
Results of tests on the former Montreal Canadiens great Maurice Richard for a suspected recurrence of abdominal cancer are expected next week, his agent said yesterday.
The agent, Jean Roy, said Richard, 78, known as the Rocket, may be released from Hotel Dieu hospital in Montreal today.

Richard, who scored a team-record 544 goals for the Canadiens in the 1940's and 1950's, was diagnosed with a rare form of abdominal cancer more than two years ago. He fell ill again recently with a painful weakening of his legs after beginning to take a new medication to control the onset of a light form of Parkinson's disease. (AP)

FOOTE MAY PLAY AGAIN: Colorado defenseman Adam Foote said he's recovering more quickly than the team expected from a recent eye injury and could play again against the Dallas Stars in the Western Conference finals.

Foote suffered bleeding and blurred vision in his right eye after he was hit with the blade of a stick in Game 2 of the four-of-seven series Monday at Dallas. It took four stitches to close a cut in his eyelid.
Foote won't play in Game 3 tonight, though he would not rule out playing after that.
''If it keeps improving the way it has, there's a great possibility that I'll be back,'' Foote said. (Bloomberg News)
